Key Match Events: Mike Burrows made his MLB debut and got his first win, limiting New York to two runs (one earned) across 3â…“ innings as the winning pitcher in the Pirates' 9-4 victory against the Yankees.
Pre-Game Insights: Mike Burrows had all sorts of support from his loved ones in the club level down the left-field line, including his parents, sisters, fiancee, future mother-in-law, and countless friends.
Post-Match Reflections: Pirates manager Derek Shelton was impressed with Burrows' fastball, which sat in the mid-90s, and thought it was a big win for the team.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Burrows was added to the Pirates roster when rookie right-hander Jared Jones was optioned to the Florida Complex League Pirates, and he reminded those outside the organization why he was such a highly regarded prospect not terribly long ago.
Others: Burrows had a repertoire that features three above-average offerings in a four-seam fastball, changeup, and curveball, and he recorded his first career strikeout on a changeup that dropped out of the zone.
